Performs phlebotomy, CPR, Injections, and other skills within scope of practice. · Demonstrate proficiency in computer skills, Windows computer function, computer navigation, and ability to use computerized patient care systems. · Knowledge of all safety requirements when handling biohazardous specimens or contaminated instruments. · Verbal skills to effectively convey sensitive information in a courteous manner in person or on the telephone. · Ability to lead a team with effective communication, collaboration and maintaining high-quality standards. · Ability to work cooperatively with other staff members, faculty, patients, nursing staff and others. · Team building and leadership skills, preferably to include prior supervisory experience Preferred: Knowledge of all instruments and supplies to perform physical examinations and/or procedures Supervisory experience

description: < Back to job list Senior Systems Engineer (12 Month Fixed Term Contract) Martin-Baker Denham, United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland Ref#: 147275 Senior Systems Engineer (12 Month Fixed Term Contract) Denham Martin-Baker is the world’s leading manufacturer of ejection and crashworthy seats, saving over 7,805 lives to date. We combine cutting-edge engineering with a clear mission: protecting aircrew around the world. We are now recruiting a Senior Systems Engineer (12 month Fixed Term contract) to join our established Systems Engineering team at our Denham site. The Role: As a Senior Systems Engineer, you will lead complex analytical engineering activities across the full product lifecycle — from concept and development through to production and verification. You will be responsible for maintaining system requirements, conducting in-depth analyses, supporting system verification, and producing highly technical documentation required for internal, customer, and contractual purposes. You will also play a key role in mentoring Systems Engineers, helping maximise team capability, quality, and productivity while supporting continuous professional development. This role offers exposure to cutting-edge aerospace systems engineering within a highly specialised and safety-critical environment. Key Responsibilities: Conduct system requirements analysis and generate specifications Prepare highly complex technical documentation for internal, customer, and contract use Perform feasibility studies and trade-off analyses to support new and existing programmes Carry out physiological load assessments as required Conduct simulations, analyses, and test matching using appropriate software tools Develop new simulation models and innovative analysis techniques Design and develop software, including safety-critical applications Support system verification activities across the product lifecycle Coach, mentor, and support other Systems Engineers, including new hires Communicate effectively with stakeholders at all levels within the organisation and with customers Participate in IPT meetings, design reviews, and technical presentations Travel within the UK and overseas as required About You We are looking for highly capable, analytical, and motivated engineers with a passion for complex systems and safety-critical aerospace products. Essential: Degree (2:1 or above) in engineering, science, or a related discipline Extensive experience in aerospace or similar systems engineering environments Strong understanding of multi-disciplinary engineering principles and practices Proven experience producing complex technical documentation Understanding of software development and systems modelling Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, including senior stakeholder engagement Innovative problem-solving ability underpinned by strong analytical skills Highly IT literate Ability to mentor and support junior engineers Desirable: Understanding of UML and/or SysML Experience developing simulation models Chartered Engineer (CEng) status Benefits: 9% non-contributory pension (18+) Midday finish on Fridays 4x salary Life Assurance (18+) Personalised training & development plan Healthcare Cash Plan 25 days holiday + bank holidays Option to purchase additional annual leave Cycle to Work & nursery benefits Discounts via the Martin-Baker+ platform Your Interview Journey: Initial Telephone Interview: A detailed discussion with your Recruitment Business Partner First Stage Interview (Microsoft Teams): Structured interview with the Hiring Manager Final Stage Interview: Face-to-face technical and competency interview Why Join Us? At Martin-Baker, your work directly contributes to saving lives. Every child we support is unique, and so is the care we give. Are you, or could you be a caring, patient, and supportive Residential Support Worker , ready to help change children’s lives for the better? If so, you’ll be providing the very best care for our young people with learning disabilities, who are verbal/ non-verbal and who have associated medical needs.  We will give you full training to be able to do your job and excel as a valued part of our business as well providing a clear and tailored career pathway. We put our children at the centre of every decision, so you’ll share our values of Respect, Dignity, Equality, Compassion and Commitment.  If you are passionate about delivering outstanding outcomes for young people with learning disabilities, and want to have a lasting impact, this role offers the opportunity to truly shine. What You’ll do Remain awake for the entirety of the waking night shift; ensure you achieve sufficient sleep outside of your working hours , so you are fit and safe for waking night duty Build trusting, professional relationships with children that are underpinned by clear boundaries and a strong safeguarding ethos Help young people settle down for sleep, supporting them in accordance with their care plan and risk assessments Establish positive, appropriate relationships with young people, so they feel safe, secure and free from harm; always show them unconditional positive regard and nurture Administer medications (all training will be provided) In someinstances,provide personal care – this doesn’t apply to all roles Empower young people and facilitate their active involvement in thedecision-makingprocess regarding their lives and future Attend to practical matters in relation to childcare (for example food preparation, cleaning up, keeping the home secure during the nighttime shift) Be vigilant to the security of the premises at night; ensure all doors and windows are locked. Provide support on a 1:1 basis as appropriate to enable young people to address past and present difficulties Attend and contribute to regular supervision sessions with your manager, according to company policy; positively receiving feedback to grow in your role What you’ll bring We’re looking for an individual who is nurturing and resilient with unwavering commitment to quality and the best possible outcomes for our children. What You’ll need Ideally a level 3 or 4 diploma in Residential Care but it isn’t essential as we will fully fund this qualification – it is a requirement to be attained within 2 years. A desire to help others and a genuinereason whyyou think you can provide outstanding care and support If you haveexperienceofsupporting young people with learning disabilitiesthat would be great – but this may be a whole new career for you sodon’tworry if youhaven’t. Philosophy that only the best is good enough when it comes to the children in our care Perhaps you’llhave experience in children’s educational setting, have family members with needs, a background helping and supporting others or a deep sense of wanting to. A driving license is heavily preferred, but if you don’t have one, don’t let that put you off from applying.  The role is also subject to an enhanced DBS check. Why join us? At Unique Care Group, you’re not just an employee, you’re a valued voice shaping the needs of our young people and the future of our homes as we continue to grow. We genuinely pride ourselves on developing our people and giving them opportunity to progress.  All our Registered Managers started life with us as Support Workers or Team Leaders and through our clear career pathway and tailored career progression plans have progressed. What we offer: Competitive salary + bonus scheme Genuine career progression in a growing company CPD and meaningful ongoing training – level5, 7, Masters etc. Tailored career progression plans, and we actively encourage and fund all qualifications A supportive, people-first culture – the tools and investment you need to be the best you and your team can be Regular supervision and professional development Company pension Employee Assistance Programme Free meals on shift Want to learn more first? Focussing on digital X-Ray and Non-Destructive Testing (NDT) within aerospace and defence manufacturing where accuracy and integrity truly make a difference. title: Mobile Service Technician
description: Murphy-Hoffman Company, LLC is North America’s largest Kenworth truck dealership group and leasing group. As MHC continues to grow, we have an opening for a Mobile Diesel Service Technician / Mechanic. The role of the Mobile Diesel Service Technician / Mechanic is to perform heavy-duty mechanical truck repair and maintenance offsite at customer locations. Develops relationships with customers to achieve labor sales quota and increase sales to assigned accounts in a designated territory. Analyzes customer operations for opportunities to increase service sales in the given territory. Performs routine mechanical repairs and maintenance on heavy-duty truck equipment and related components with general supervision. Coordinates customer repair orders with Service Manager and Shop Foremen for task assignment. Coordinates with Service Advisor for proper work scheduling of all mobile maintenance business. Advises customer of needed service work, as well as suggests additional labor, parts and body shop sales whenever possible (i.e., Preventive Maintenance Inspections, related service work, etc.). Follows safe work practices and procedures, uses safety equipment when required, responds to suggestions for working safely and seeks assistance when necessary. Ensures proper safety, care, and maintenance of company vehicles assigned to the technician. Reports any damage to company or customer equipment or property immediately to supervisor. Maintains favorable relations with customers. Creates and closes repair orders in the MHC business system to document the repair work performed and the time spent completing the repair. Completes paperwork as required to accurately document the work performed. Controls business expenses within the approved expense budget and is responsible for tooling and parts inventory on the service truck. Oversees operations of assigned customers in territory. Calls upon key accounts (current and prospective) regularly. Introduces items such as preventive maintenance, new products, and promotions, reemphasizes existing products and services and provide literature as necessary. Responsible for achieving labor sales objectives and quota for assigned accounts. Performs other duties as assigned by supervisor. SAFETY-SENSITIVE This position has been designated as a safety-sensitive position.  Any person performing the position while under the influence of marijuana or any other illegal drug may constitute a threat to health or safety or in which a lapse of attention could result in injury, illness, or death, including without limitation a position that includes the operating, repairing, maintaining, or monitoring of heavy equipment, machinery, aircraft, motorized watercraft, or motor vehicles or handling of hazardous materials and/or waste as part of the job duties. Qualifications Minimum three years’ heavy duty truck repair experience. A/C, Brake and DOT Annual Inspector certifications required. Engine and Component certifications are a plus. Must be self-motivated and capable of working with little supervision. Must have a commitment to customer satisfaction and perform quality repairs. Must have excellent communication skills. Must have a positive can-do attitude. Necessary tools to perform position responsibilities. Class A or B CDL and/or DOT medical card may be required depending upon the size of the mobile service vehicle.

title: 2026 Summer Operations Intern
description: Murphy-Hoffman Company (MHC-Kenworth) is a multi-state network of Kenworth truck dealers providing more than 50,000 customers with a full range of truck services.  MHC's Operations Intern Program is a 12-week version of our Management Trainee Program.  Over the course of the summer, you will be given a hands-on deep dive into how our Parts or Service Department operates, by rotating through each position in the department and helping contribute to the business. Execute business initiatives while receiving hands-on experience in all facets of the dealership. Utilize education, training, and experience to perform assigned job functions under close supervision of a manager or other designated employees. Develop skills necessary to rotate within the assigned department to get a comprehensive understanding of running the business. Opportunity to make an impact on the business by conducting a summer-long process improvement project. The Summer Management Operations Internship is a pipeline into MHC"s Full-Time Management Trainee Program! What's in it for you: Starting pay $20 per hour On-the-job exposure to leading a business within a billion-dollar industry! On-the-job training and succession planning for personal career goals Opportunities for networking and professional connection Qualifications Actively pursuing a graduate or undergraduate degree at an accredited college or university. Willingness to work 40 hours per week for 10-12 weeks during the summer months. Leadership and sales skills strongly preferred. Strong commitment to providing quality work and excellent customer service. Ability to accept constructive feedback.
Qualifications: Actively pursuing a graduate or undergraduate degree at an accredited college or university. Willingness to work 40 hours per week for 10-12 weeks during the summer months. Leadership and sales skills strongly preferred. Strong commitment to providing quality work and excellent customer service. Ability to accept constructive feedback.

title: Management Trainee
description: Are you ready to embark on a journey in the trucking industry with a company that's been guiding the way for over 45 years? Join MHC, we’re a family-owned company seeking enthusiastic and driven people to join our Management Trainee Program. With over 125 locations across 18 states and an impressive track record of financial success, MHC offers an unparalleled opportunity to launch your career in the world of transportation and logistics. As a Management Trainee at MHC, you'll be immersed in a comprehensive 7-month rotational program designed to equip you with the experience, knowledge, and guidance necessary to excel in a management role. This isn't your typical entry-level role – you'll have the chance to work alongside seasoned team members, engage in innovative projects, and gain exposure to all facets of our business operations, including Parts, Service, Leasing, Management, and more! What We're Looking For: · Driven self-starters with a passion for critical thinking and a desire to grow within our company. · Strong communication and the aptitude to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams. · Flexible people who thrive in dynamic environments and can navigate obstacles with a positive attitude. · Bachelor's degree in Business, Logistics, Supply Chain Management, Sales, Agriculture, or a related field. · An obligation to upholding MHC's core values of integrity, customer focus, teamwork, and innovation. Why Choose MHC: · Career Growth: Our Management Trainee Program is the springboard for a fulfilling career at MHC. The path from trainee to management is clearly defined from the beginning of your career with us. · Comprehensive Training: You'll receive extensive training from MHC’s executive teams, gaining insights into the operations of our business. · Generous Compensation: We value your contributions and offer a generous salary package with performance-based incentives during the second phase of the program. · Employee-Centric Culture: Join a team that treats you like family, where your opinions are valued, and your growth is our priority. If you're ready to jumpstart your career with a company that's been driving excellence for over four decades, apply now to be part of the MHC Management Trainee Program! Qualifications Bachelor’s degree is strongly preferred. Leadership and sales skills strongly preferred. Strong commitment to providing quality work and excellent customer service. Ability to accept constructive feedback. Must be willing to relocate at time of permanent placement.
Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree is strongly preferred. Leadership and sales skills strongly preferred. Strong commitment to providing quality work and excellent customer service. Ability to accept constructive feedback. Must be willing to relocate at time of permanent placement.

title: Diesel Service Technician Mechanic
description: Murphy-Hoffman Company, LLC is North America’s largest Kenworth truck dealership group and leasing group. As MHC continues to grow, we have an opening for a Diesel Service Technician / Mechanic. The role of the Diesel Service Technician / Mechanic performs heavy-duty mechanical repair under general supervision, receiving on the job training in a development program to achieve Service Journeyman status. Performs and/or assists in the performance of general mechanical duties. Gains experience by working on the following items with minimal supervision: engine overhaul, fuel systems, electrical systems, transmissions, cooling systems, chassis, brakes, engine tune-up, and general maintenance. Works on major components with close supervision. Performs trouble shooting on minor problems. Attends training sessions and meetings. Maintains a neat and orderly working area, and proper handling of company tools. Advises the Shop Foreman if additional repair work is necessary. Follows safe work practices and procedures, uses safety equipment when required, responds to suggestions for working safely and seeks assistance when necessary. Performs other duties as assigned by supervisor. SAFETY-SENSITIVE This position has been designated as a safety-sensitive position.  Any person performing the position while under the influence of marijuana or any other illegal drug may constitute a threat to health or safety or in which a lapse of attention could result in injury, illness, or death, including without limitation a position that includes the operating, repairing, maintaining, or monitoring of heavy equipment, machinery, aircraft, motorized watercraft, or motor vehicles or handling of hazardous materials and/or waste as part of the job duties. Qualifications CDL preferred. Minimum three years hands-on experience or graduate of vocational courses. A/C, Brake and DOT Annual Inspector Certifications required. Necessary tools to perform position responsibilities.

title: Warranty Operations Manager
description: Murphy-Hoffman Company, LLC is North America’s largest Kenworth truck dealership group and leasing group. As MHC continues to grow, we have an opening for a Warranty Operations Manager. Manages Warranty Department to determine which repairs are warrantable and maintains strong relationships with branches and vendors. Manages and directs the staff of Warranty Analysts to maintain overall process improvement and efficiencies related to centralized warranty claim processing. This is an in-office position at our KCMO location. Manages Warranty Analysts to make sure warranty claims are administered in the most fair and honest manner for the customer, vendor, and MHC. Provides training to branch staff and Warranty Analysts to ensure that vendor warranty procedures and requirements are understood and followed. Evaluates the corporate warranty department to make sure the department is properly staffed based on claim volume to support the branches. Evaluates Warranty Analyst performance and provides coaching to increase efficiency and minimize claim write off. Works with warranty vendors capture appropriate warranty labor rate recovery and that standard repair time estimates accurately reflect the time necessary to complete the repairs. Continuously analyzes the department’s performance and provides direction for process improvement. Ensures proper communication between the branch and Warranty Analyst is taking place. Monitors warranty claims to achieve MHC’s warranty day’s sales outstanding (DSO) standard. Follows up on past due claims to make sure these claims are resolved quickly. Researches and completes special projects at the request of management. Performs other duties as assigned by supervisor. Qualifications Strong knowledge of heavy-duty truck vendor warranty process. Minimum two years’ experience in heavy duty truck service or processing warranty claims. Proficiency with Microsoft Office Software. Must be detail oriented. Must have excellent communication, presentation, and customer service skills. Willing to travel up to 30%. Must have a positive can-do attitude and a strong work ethic.
Qualifications: Strong knowledge of heavy-duty truck vendor warranty process. Minimum two years’ experience in heavy duty truck service or processing warranty claims. Proficiency with Microsoft Office Software. Must be detail oriented. Must have excellent communication, presentation, and customer service skills. Willing to travel up to 30%. Must have a positive can-do attitude and a strong work ethic.

title: Management Trainee
description: Are you ready to embark on a journey in the trucking industry with a company that's been guiding the way for over 45 years? Join MHC, we’re a family-owned company seeking enthusiastic and driven people to join our Management Trainee Program. With over 125 locations across 18 states and an impressive track record of financial success, MHC offers an unparalleled opportunity to launch your career in the world of transportation and logistics. As a Management Trainee at MHC, you'll be immersed in a comprehensive 7-month rotational program designed to equip you with the experience, knowledge, and guidance necessary to excel in a management role. This isn't your typical entry-level role – you'll have the chance to work alongside seasoned team members, engage in innovative projects, and gain exposure to all facets of our business operations, including Parts, Service, Leasing, Management, and more! What We're Looking For: · Driven self-starters with a passion for critical thinking and a desire to grow within our company. · Strong communication and the aptitude to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams. · Flexible people who thrive in dynamic environments and can navigate obstacles with a positive attitude. · Bachelor's degree in Business, Logistics, Supply Chain Management, Sales, Agriculture, or a related field. · An obligation to upholding MHC's core values of integrity, customer focus, teamwork, and innovation. Why Choose MHC: · Career Growth: Our Management Trainee Program is the springboard for a fulfilling career at MHC. The path from trainee to management is clearly defined from the beginning of your career with us. · Comprehensive Training: You'll receive extensive training from MHC’s executive teams, gaining insights into the operations of our business. · Generous Compensation: We value your contributions and offer a generous salary package with performance-based incentives during the second phase of the program. · Employee-Centric Culture: Join a team that treats you like family, where your opinions are valued, and your growth is our priority. If you're ready to jumpstart your career with a company that's been driving excellence for over four decades, apply now to be part of the MHC Management Trainee Program! title: Outside Parts Salesperson
description: Murphy-Hoffman Company, LLC is North America’s largest Kenworth truck dealership group and leasing group. As MHC continues to grow, we have an opening for an Outside Parts Salesperson. The Outside Parts Salesperson develops and achieves maximum profitable sales volume of parts and labor services from assigned accounts in a designated territory. Analyzes customer operations to ascertain future parts, service and truck requirements. Develops and achieves maximum sales volume consistent with realistic sales projections for assigned accounts focusing on parts and labor sales opportunities. Oversees operations of assigned customers. Advises or assists them in such areas as inventory selection and control, service available, new products and services, etc. Plans territory coverage. Calls upon key accounts (current and prospective) regularly. Takes orders, introduces new products and promotions, reemphasizes existing products and services and provide literature as necessary. Completes customer call sheets weekly, stating summary of calls made. Controls personal expenses within the approved expense budget and submits weekly expense reports. Promotes all MHC product and service offerings including RoadForce, Service, Body Shop, Truck Sales, Leasing, Carrier and Finance. Investigates and refer customer complaints to the appropriate Department Manager and/or Branch Manager. Assists, whenever necessary, the counter personnel with orders, deliveries, returns, inventory and other tasks as assigned. Performs other duties as assigned by supervisor. SAFETY-SENSITIVE This position has been designated as a safety-sensitive position.  Any person performing the position while under the influence of marijuana or any other illegal drug may constitute a threat to health or safety or in which a lapse of attention could result in injury, illness, or death, including without limitation a position that includes the operating, repairing, maintaining, or monitoring of heavy equipment, machinery, aircraft, motorized watercraft, or motor vehicles or handling of hazardous materials and/or waste as part of the job duties. Qualifications One-year automotive parts related experience. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Experience dealing with the public in sales/service capacity. Computer skills preferred.
Qualifications: One-year automotive parts related experience. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Experience dealing with the public in sales/service capacity. Computer skills preferred.

title: Management Trainee
description: Are you ready to embark on a journey in the trucking industry with a company that's been guiding the way for over 45 years? Join MHC, we’re a family-owned company seeking enthusiastic and driven people to join our Management Trainee Program. With over 125 locations across 18 states and an impressive track record of financial success, MHC offers an unparalleled opportunity to launch your career in the world of transportation and logistics. As a Management Trainee at MHC, you'll be immersed in a comprehensive 7-month rotational program designed to equip you with the experience, knowledge, and guidance necessary to excel in a management role. This isn't your typical entry-level role – you'll have the chance to work alongside seasoned team members, engage in innovative projects, and gain exposure to all facets of our business operations, including Parts, Service, Leasing, Management, and more! title: 2026 Summer Operations Intern
description: Murphy-Hoffman Company (MHC-Kenworth) is a multi-state network of Kenworth truck dealers providing more than 50,000 customers with a full range of truck services.  MHC's Operations Intern Program is a 12-week version of our Management Trainee Program.  Over the course of the summer, you will be given a hands-on deep dive into how our Parts or Service Department operates, by rotating through each position in the department and helping contribute to the business. title: Outside Parts Salesperson
description: Murphy-Hoffman Company, LLC is North America’s largest Kenworth truck dealership group and leasing group. As MHC continues to grow, we have an opening for an Outside Parts Salesperson.
